SALESFORCE HELP

EINSTEIN PERSONALIZATION
Configure Recommendation Filters

Define optional recommendation filters to either include or exclude eligible content that matches filter conditions.

REQUIRED USER PERMISSIONS
USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To configure recommendation filters:	Change and Edit Recommenders

To add filters to a recommender that you haven’t saved yet, go to step 5.

From the App Launcher, search for and select Recommenders.
Open the recommender that you want to add filters to.
Click Edit.
Click Next to progress through the Recommender Properties configuration until you reach the Filters window. 
Select either the Include or Exclude filter tab.
This selection enables you to control whether to include or exclude items that match defined filters as recommendation options. For example, you can add an include filter that shows items valued greater than $100. 
Select when you want filters to take action.
OPTION	DESCRIPTION
All Conditions Are Met	If all conditions are met, items are either included or excluded as potential recommendation content.
Any Condition Is Met	If any one of the conditions is met,  items are either included or excluded as potential recommendation content.
Click Add Condition.
Select the Item Data Graph Resource. This is the value that Einstein Personalization uses to evaluate an item’s eligibility to be recommended.
You can choose an attribute for the filter to use when evaluating an item’s eligibility for recommendation, or you can choose a calculated insight. Choosing a calculated insight enables you to define additional recommender output by applying an added sort measure to either recommendation type. You can select a calculated insight to add a sort measure to a goal-based recommendation, or refine a rule-based recommendation by layering on an additional sort measure.
Select a filter type.
OPTION	DESCRIPTION
Decision Context	Using the item that the visitor is currently interacting with, this option filters recommendation items by matching item attributes against the selected data graph resource. For example, if you select a data graph resource of Color, this option includes or excludes items that match the color of the item the visitor is currently viewing.
Static	This option filters items based on specific item attributes, like price, category, publish date, and so on. For example, you can configure a filter to include items under $10 or exclude items published before a specified date.
Profile Data Graph	

When making filter decisions, this option uses calculated insights to consider values associated with visitor activity. For example, you can exclude items the user has purchased before, or show an item to only returning visitors.

To use this option for filtering decisions, you must first create a calculated insight associated with the selected profile data graph.

(Optional) Add another filter condition.
Click Save.
Einstein Personalization creates the recommender. You can select the recommender for use by any personalization point decision.
SEE ALSO
Creating and Training Einstein Personalization Recommenders
Configure a Recommender

title: Configuring Recommendation Filters in Einstein Personalization
